image.altText: A close up shot of a man wearing glasses and a baseball cap

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly killed WA police officer Anthony Woods has his murder charge downgraded to manslaughter.

title.children: Murder charge over Perth police officer's death downgraded

image.altText: WA Police Commissioner Col Blanch speaks about GPS Tracking of serious and repeat FDV offenders

props.synopsis: WA's Police Commissioner Col Blanch deflects blame for gaps in the monitoring of the most serious domestic violence offenders, saying he would put them in prison if he could.

title.children: Police chief plays down severity of gaps in DV offender GPS tracking

image.altText: Man in suit behind podium and microphone talking.

props.synopsis: It was a major government policy meant to provide extra safety for some of the state's most vulnerable. Now a letter has revealed just how the implementation of WA's domestic violence strategy targeting repeat offenders went so badly wrong.

title.children: The cracks emerged early. Now WA's DV promise has come crashing down

image.altText: A woman fills out a ballot.

props.synopsis: The federal election result could be known while West Australians are still scrambling to the polling booth. But in a close race, sandgropers could once again hold the keys to the Lodge.

title.children: Here are the crucial WA seats to watch in the federal election

image.altText: A woman in an electric wheelchair named Eleanor Beidatsch pictured outside a polling place.

props.synopsis: Eleanor Beidatsch details the challenges she faces while voting in a wheelchair, while people with "invisible disabilities" can face even bigger hurdles.

title.children: For those of us with disabilities, voting can be an overwhelming experience

image.altText: Kendrick Lamar smiles and points as he performs in a blue and black leather jacket, blue jeans, gloves and a black backwards cap

props.synopsis: No crying over this one, mates. Spilt Milk is back in action for 2025 after taking a break last year, with Kendrick Lamar and Doechii headlining the festival for its shows in Perth, Ballarat, Canberra and the Gold Coast.

title.children: Kendrick Lamar heading to Perth for Spilt Milk's big return this December

image.altText: Peter Dutton speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton tells reporters in WA that he and his team have "worked hard every day and night" during the campaign and "there's no doubt in my mind we can be successful in the election". Follow live.

title.children: Dutton has 'no doubt' the Coalition can win this election

image.altText: Zempilas and Papalia

props.synopsis: WA Opposition leader Basil Zempilas says the state government has misled the public over the use of GPS trackers for serious repeat domestic violence offenders after a letter suggested there were warnings against their use outside of Perth.

title.children: Minister accused of misleading public over tracking WA domestic violence offenders

image.altText: A black and white picture of matthew with his family on the couch

props.synopsis: Police charge a 22-year-old man over a fatal hit-and-run that claimed the life of a Perth father in Golden Bay more than four years ago.

title.children: Police charge man over WA's only unsolved fatal hit-and-run since 2016

image.altText: A moody photo of Trisha Blake standing with a serious expression in an office.

props.synopsis: With the state government set to start offering rebates for home batteries on July 1, consumer protection authorities have warned to be wary of scams.

title.children: Scam texts warning as anticipation builds for home battery rebates

image.altText: a white skyscrapper with rio tinto

props.synopsis: A delegation of Pilbara traditional owners has accused Rio Tinto of not giving investors the full story about the environmental and social impacts of its WA mines.

title.children: Rio Tinto executives lashed by traditional owners at AGM

image.altText: Two neighbouring homes, one with a sign for Kate Chaney the other for Tom White.

props.synopsis: Even in WA's most affluent electorate, cost-of-living pressures are weighing on voters' minds, as Curtin hopeful Tom White tries to win back the prized seat for the Liberals from teal independent Kate Chaney.

title.children: Climate concern shrinks in blue-ribbon Curtin, as Kate Chaney fights to survive

image.altText: A graphic shows a smartphone screen showing a graph.

props.synopsis: Housing, cost of living, health and Australia's energy future have been front and centre this election campaign. Here's what the Vote Compass data tells us about where respondents stand on key issues.

title.children: Vote Compass data reveals key issues for respondents ahead of election

image.altText: voters

props.synopsis: As the countdown to May 3 draws nearer, a growing group of gen Z and millennial voters are threatening to destabilise key seats. Here's why.

title.children: The 'unpredictable' group of voters that could influence these key seats

image.altText: two male politicians wearing suits at a park

props.synopsis: The Coalition enters the dying hours of the 2025 election campaign defending its budget against charges from some of the nation's top economists that it erodes the Coalition's self-declared legacy of fiscal responsibility.

title.children: Voter 'bribes' send Taylor 'off brand' with bigger deficits, say budget experts

image.altText: A brown cow stands in an orange paddock with a wind turbine in the background.

props.synopsis: A carbon farming project developer is looking to sign up growers in WA's Mid West Wheatbelt region to $15,000-a-year contracts, leading one expert to ring alarm bells.

title.children: Professor warns of carbon farming risk in 'unlikely' success areas

image.altText: A person posing for a selfie near the 40m cliff at The Gap on WA's south coast.

props.synopsis: Authorities say visitors are putting their lives in danger by going beyond the safety barriers to take photos at the Gap, a popular tourist site near Albany in WA.

title.children: Rescuers fed up with tourists risking lives for selfies at coastal cliff

image.altText: Two women in high-vis and hard hats at a rare earths refinery.

props.synopsis: Kalgoorlie-Boulder Mayor Glenn Wilson defends a decision to not publicly release an independent review of the council's water supply contract with Lynas Rare Earths, saying it could risk potential legal claims worth millions.

title.children: 'Extremely disappointed': Lynas say it signed water contract in good faith

image.altText: A pile of electronic power boards.

props.synopsis: The only e-waste recycling facility servicing the state's Midwest is forced to close, leaving residents in the one-bin city of Geraldton with even fewer options for climate-conscious rubbish disposal.

title.children: Geraldton volunteer can no longer divert items from landfill due to lack of profit

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: As voters head to the ballot box prepared to cast votes on the issue of housing affordability, new data shows national house prices trended higher in April, and are expected to keep rising as interest rates fall.

title.children: Property prices lift and growth in house values continues to outpace units

image.altText: People walk through the Chadstone Shopping Centre

props.synopsis: Labor and the Coalition are promising to spend big to help households deal with the cost of living. Here's what you need to know.

title.children: What the major parties' cost-of-living pledges mean for you

image.altText: Two men in martial arts outfits punch.

props.synopsis: Take a look at the best photos from the ABC News team in Western Australia from April, including action shots, art therapy and moments on the federal election campaign trail.

title.children: These are the Perth newsroom's top picks for photography across April

image.altText: Albanese stands in the middle of a group of children, he's looking to the side with palms pressed together in greeting

props.synopsis: As Albanese and Dutton crisscrossed the country aiming to win over voters, ABC photographers were there to capture the best images of the campaign.

title.children: Two wannabe PMs, a media pack and the search for gold

image.altText: A mural dedicated to the Australian women killed by domestic violence in 2024 and 2025

props.synopsis: Violence against women has stirred outrage among voters and politicians have promised to do something about it. Their policy proposals tell a different story, write Heidi Davoren and Mary Lloyd.

title.children: It's the 'national crisis' that neither party has been able to solve

image.altText: A jar of pencils.

props.synopsis: Think you know the numbers behind the federal election? Try our quiz!

title.children: Test your knowledge with our federal election numbers quiz

image.altText: An Amazon package sits on a doorstep.

props.synopsis: US stocks continue to reclaim ground from their post-tariff losses, with the S&P 500 gaining for an eighth straight session to reach its highest level since April 2. Amazon's shares fell in extended trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Amazon disappoints Wall St amid tariff uncertainty

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Inflation surge 'firmly in the rear-view mirror': Westpac
How Apple is avoiding China tariffs

image.altText: a woman closes a gate in sheepyards.

props.synopsis: Sheep producers have slammed a leaked "confidential" document containing draft plans of the Albanese government's multimillion-dollar support package for farmers affected by the live export ban.

title.children: Leaked draft of $45m federal aid plan for sheep farmers 'a shemozzle'

image.altText: Pauline Hanson having her selfie taken with a young man.

props.synopsis: In a last-minute campaign dash to the west, Pauline Hanson dropped in on the Nullarbor Muster to speak to voters days out from the federal election.

title.children: 'Forgotten' voters flock to Pauline Hanson amid Nullarbor visit

image.altText: Unidentified woman in forground with left hand holding black and white holding ultrasound of baby scan

props.synopsis: A child born to an overseas commercial surrogate is in legal limbo, with experts estimating hundreds of other Australian children are also living with uncertain parentage.

title.children: Children left in legal limbo amid Australia's complex surrogacy laws

image.altText: A map highlights locations in the north Pacific Ocean, near Hawai'i

props.synopsis: Scientists and legal experts warn against commercial deep-sea mining as US President Donald Trump signs an executive order opening up both US and international waters.

title.children: 'Inherently destructive': Trump's deep-sea mining order sparks backlash

image.altText: Shells from dredging near Port Arthur

props.synopsis: Test yourself with this week's quiz.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: An incident at sea, a shell-based discovery and a voting refresher course

image.altText: A composite image of two people with blurred faces wearing blue Liberal Party t-shirts.

props.synopsis: Members of a secretive Christian sect are being given instructions on how to lie about their beliefs against voting in elections, in an apparent coordinated effort to campaign for the Liberal and National parties.

title.children: Secretive church sect followers told to deny beliefs on voting, in campaign backing Coalition
